definition[0]: someone who is right on supports social justice, equal rights, the protection of the environment etc – often used to show disapproval because someone does this in an extreme way
example[0]: It’s one of those annoyingly right-on magazines about the environment.
definition[1]: someone is right on when they say something that is correct or that you completely agree with
example[1]: Parker’s column on teenage sexuality is right on.
definition[2]: used to emphasize that you agree with what someone says or does
